TITLE: Authenticating and Fetching Balance Using NOWPayments API - Node.js JavaScript DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates initializing the NOWPayments Mass Payments API in a Node.js environment, authenticating with email and password, then fetching and printing the account balance. Requires the '@nowpaymentsio/nowpayments-mass-payments-api-js' npm package and a valid API key. 'api.auth' returns an authentication token; 'api.getBalance' retrieves balance data. Inputs are credentials and API key; output is logged balance information. SOURCE: https://github.com/nowpaymentsio/nowpayments-mass-payments-api-js/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const NowPaymentsMPApi = require('@nowpaymentsio/nowpayments-mass-payments-api-js'); const api = new NowPaymentsMPApi({ apiKey: 'your-api-key' }) // your api key async function logBalance() { const { token } = await api.auth({ email: 'your-email', password: 'your-password' }) const balance = await api.getBalance({ token }) console.log('Get balance: ', balance) } logBalance() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Integrating NOWPayments API to Fetch Balance in a React Component - JavaScript DESCRIPTION: Illustrates using the NOWPayments Mass Payments API in a React functional component. It authenticates a user, fetches the balance asynchronously, and displays the balance as key-value pairs. Dependencies: '@nowpaymentsio/nowpayments-mass-payments-api-js' package, React. Key parameters are API key, user email, password; outputs are balance values mapped and rendered as paragraphs. Proper error-handling and real credetials should be used in production. SOURCE: https://github.com/nowpaymentsio/nowpayments-mass-payments-api-js/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import React from 'react' import NowPaymentsMPApi from '@nowpaymentsio/nowpayments-mass-payments-api-js' const npApi = new NowPaymentsMPApi({ apiKey: 'your-api-key' }) // your api key const App = () => { const [balance, setBalance] = React.useState() React.useEffect(() => { async function fetchBalance() { const { token } = await npApi.auth({ email: 'your-email', password: 'your-password' }) const balance = await npApi.getBalance({ token }) setBalance(balance) } fetchBalance() }, []) return (

Each withdrawal object defines an address, currency, and amount (max 6 decimals). This structure must be used when invoking createPayout. No external dependencies required, but proper parameter construction is essential for successful payouts. Must not exceed 6 decimals (i.e. 0.123456) } ] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Fetching Balance Using NOWPayments API Directly in Browser - HTML and JavaScript DESCRIPTION: Describes an HTML page embedding the NOWPayments SDK via CDN, authenticating and retrieving balance using browser-native JavaScript. After authentication, balance entries are displayed dynamically. Requires the NOWPayments script to be included, an API key, and user credentials. Main limitation is security: credentials appear in client-side code and should not be used in production with real data.
